Thus have I heard. Once the Buddha was in the Jeta Grove of the country of Shravasti. At that time
there was an outcaste woman.
She specialized in various evil spells and incantations.
She served mountain spirits, tree spirits, and ghosts under trees.
The sun, moon, five stars, Southern Dipper, and Northern Dipper.
All kinds of demons, miscellaneous demons, and evil ghosts.
She confused Venerable Ananda and other good people.
There were as many of these as there are sands in the Ganges River.
At that time, the Tathagata saw that Ananda was confused.
Out of compassion for all,
he expounded this Sutra of the Six-Syllable Divine Spell King.
